fields.description:
The cloud controller binds port 443 for HTTP/HTTPS web services.

All ports used should be configurable and documented and in this case should perhaps be optional.

comments.body:
git branch: dev/ethomas/EUCA-7686-2
git show 2f887a4c0d1280bec00a676a07dc9a37777573b1

1) Removed hard coded 443 netty port
2) Added logging to show PropertyChangeListener instantiation failure (there are several)
3) changed RestartWebServicePropertyListener (public static class) to work as a listener, but there are some issues in running WebServices.restart() in that thread (kills the euca-modify-property socket, for one)
4) Added a periodic listener (60 seconds) to check a selected group of bootstrap.webservices.* properties (all those whose listener was RestartWebServicePropertyListener) and if any have changed, call WebServices.restart().  Log messages appropriately as well.

An open question is: are there other properties we should include in this list.  Right now I have done everything that had a listener on it for restart of the web service.

Looks OK to me. I noted the following but I do not think we need to address these for 4.0:

* To atomically set a flag it would be better to use AtomicBoolean.compareAndSet. 
* The debug log message should be reduced to trace level if it is being logged every 60 seconds. 
* The restart thread could use try/finally to ensure that the running flag is cleared if an error occurs.

QA should verify that if any of the properties are changed to invalid values there is some way to recover (other than making database changes manually)

One more quick set of diffs to address the issues after the first review
git branch: dev/ethomas/EUCA-7686-2
git show f08765b06424a1026cfd29f5ea33b1ba062df8bf  (use AtomicBoolean.compareAndSet, did try/finally around the restart thread, and changed LOG.debug to LOG.trace)

git show cdf71a0e8b931006a03a77ddeaabeb667f67b764 (created new listeners to check property value types)
Looks good to me. Thanks for adding in the extra validation and updating the logging, focus on the UX as well as functionality is appreciated.

[~ethomas],

I set the port to 80 and saw the proper log messages:
{noformat}
2014-04-15 14:39:04  INFO | i-5c6fa60f state change: PENDING -> RUNNING (previously PENDING)
2014-04-15 15:56:46  WARN | Failed to set property: bootstrap.webservices.port because of For input string: "viglesias"
2014-04-15 15:57:04  INFO | bootstrap.webservices.port has changed: oldValue = 8773, newValue = 80
2014-04-15 15:57:04  INFO | One or more bootstrap.webservices properties have changed, calling WebServices.restart() [May change ports]
2014-04-15 15:57:04  INFO | Creating server worker thread pool. (log level EXTREME for details)
2014-04-15 15:57:04  INFO | Creating server bootstrap. (log level EXTREME for details)
2014-04-15 15:57:04  INFO | WebServices.restart() complete
{noformat}

I now see that port 80 is listening and usable but it seems that 8773 is also listening. Is that expected behavior:
{noformat}
[root@g-12-03 ~]# netstat -lnp | grep 8773
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:8773                0.0.0.0:*                   LISTEN      11471/eucalyptus-cl
udp        0      0 228.7.7.3:8773              0.0.0.0:*                               11471/eucalyptus-cl
udp        0      0 172.16.55.3:8773            0.0.0.0:*                               11471/eucalyptus-cl
[root@g-12-03 ~]# netstat -lnp | grep 80
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:80                  0.0.0.0:*                   LISTEN      11471/eucalyptus-cl
udp        0      0 fe80::ea9a:8fff:fe74:133:123 :::*                                    6220/ntpd
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     30580  6097/tgtd           /var/run/tgtd.ipc_abstract_namespace.0
[root@g-12-03 ~]#
{noformat}
[~viglesias] Port 8773 is always listening, that is non-changeable.  It just allows another port to be used as well.   When the bootstrap.webservices.port is not 8773, an additonal port can be used.

I did some more negative testing against ports known to us to be invalid for the web-services and found that using 8777 (ie the DB port) got me into a situation where i could no longer query or modify the property. In the logs I see the following:
{noformat}
2014-04-15 16:34:04 DEBUG 000001146 Faults                   | Fault notifications: waking up to service error queue.
2014-04-15 16:34:04 DEBUG 000001146 Faults                   | Fault notifications: no state changes pending, discarding pending faults
2014-04-15 16:34:04  INFO 000000684 WebServices              | bootstrap.webservices.port has changed: oldValue = 80, newValue = 8777
2014-04-15 16:34:04  INFO 000000684 WebServices              | One or more bootstrap.webservices properties have changed, calling WebServices
.restart() [May change ports]
2014-04-15 16:34:04  INFO 000004863 WebServices              | Creating server worker thread pool. (log level EXTREME for details)
2014-04-15 16:34:04  INFO 000004863 WebServices              | Creating server bootstrap. (log level EXTREME for details)
2014-04-15 16:34:04 ERROR 000004863 WebServices              | org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelException: Failed to bind to: 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0:8
777
org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelException: Failed to bind to: 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0:8777
        at org.jboss.netty.bootstrap.ServerBootstrap.bind(ServerBootstrap.java:272)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServices.restart(WebServices.java:284)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServices$WebServicePropertiesChangedEventListener$1.run(WebServices.java:432)
Caused by: java.net.BindException: Address already in use
        at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind0(Native Method)
        at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Net.java:444)
        at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Net.java:436)
        at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(ServerSocketChannelImpl.java:214)
        at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(ServerSocketAdaptor.java:74)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerBoss$RegisterTask.run(NioServerBoss.java:193)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.AbstractNioSelector.processTaskQueue(AbstractNioSelector.java:366)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.AbstractNioSelector.run(AbstractNioSelector.java:290)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerBoss.run(NioServerBoss.java:42)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
{noformat}
Restarting the cloud did not help the situation. I believe that DB surgery will be necessary.

git branch dev/ethomas/EUCA-7686
git show 1c296e5aef73803f28fb572a6026a94fa784326d

Wrapped the bind() of the secondary port in an exception, logs an appropriate error and just doesn't bind if in use.  (8773 will always be available).  Whitelisting certain ports is hard to do as each host running the web service stack will have certain ports in use.

No longer seeing 443 being used:

{noformat}
euca-describe-instances: error (InternalFailure): java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: /10.111.5.136:8773
[root@d-12 ~]# netstat -lnp | grep 443
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:8443                0.0.0.0:*                   LISTEN      30990/eucalyptus-cl
[root@d-12 ~]# service eucalyptus-cloud status
Eucalyptus services are running
[root@d-12 ~]# ssh root@10.111.5.135
The authenticity of host '10.111.5.135 (10.111.5.135)' can't be established.
RSA key fingerprint is de:b2:04:3a:f5:40:ba:f4:92:ec:d8:ff:7b:53:98:00.
Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? yes
Warning: Permanently added '10.111.5.135' (RSA) to the list of known hosts.
Last login: Wed Apr 23 18:31:30 2014 from euca-vpn-8-86.eucalyptus-systems.com
[root@d-11 ~]#  netstat -lnp | grep 443
[root@d-11 ~]# service eucalyptus-cloud status
Eucalyptus services are running
[root@d-11 ~]#
{noformat}

Changing webservices port works like a charm.
